div.head: Legislation
div.p: Researchers may consult most public documents in the archives of the Ministry of Foreign and European Affairs after a period of 25 years under the provisions of the archives law of July 15, 2008 (law no. 2008-696). However, certain categories of documents remain closed for a longer period, and others cannot be consulted at all. Under certain conditions, a researcher may request and receive authorization to consult documents that still remain closed.

div.head: Location
div.p: The diplomatic archives may be consulted at two sites: the Centre des archives diplomatiques de La Courneuve (3, rue Suzanne-Masson, 93120 La Courneuve) and the Centre des archives diplomatiques de Nantes (17 rue de Casterneau, 44000 Nantes).

div.head: Procedures
div.p: A researcher who wishes to conduct research in the Diplomatic Archives may apply for a reader’s card after presenting official proof of identity. For further details, see the archives website.

div.head: Published Documents
div.p: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs is currently publishing four series of diplomatic documents covering the following periods: 1914 to 1919, 1920 to 1932, 1939 to 1944, and 1954 on. The ministry’s website contains a list of published volumes in these and earlier series.
